attributes.action: save the taxpayers of England the sum of £52 billion by withdrawing HMG's offer to provide the long term funding package offered to Northern Ireland as part of the St Andrews Agreement of 1 November 2006.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
On 1 November 2006 the Chancellor set out a funding package for the Northern Ireland (NI) Executive worth £50 billion as part of the St Andrews Agreement.   The Chancellor promised that the UK would commit to at least £35 billion of funding for NI over the next four years and a further £18 billion capital investment to 2017.  These official figures sum to the staggering figure of subsidy from England to NI of £52 billion.
The petitioner asks why should the English taxpayer give these extraordinary amounts of England's wealth to the small NI population of only 1.7 million (i.e. some £30,588 per person)?  England is the sole net tax contributor in the Union.  England does not believe that the intransigent politicians of NI should be rewarded with £52 billion of England's money.  The UK Government's carelessness with England's tax revenues shows clearly why England must now have her own Parliament.
